review_title: VMs and ESXI info from a good user
usecases_deployment_scope: I started to use ESXi as a way to build, control, configure, and push-out virtual machines (servers) throughout my company. I am now able to set out a selection of systems to individuals to use and once done and I have the data and work completed from an employee I can easily keep data and delete that used VM which I can relaunch at anytime from anywhere. I use these VMs so that I don't have to worry about any viruses and malware getting back into my main server. ESXi also works great with VCenter and setting up virtual networks.
likelihood_to_recommend: Having the ability to reset a VM and getting back to work faster. This is a great tool for using in ways that don't need to cost thousands of dollars to purchase another system if one fails, you simply relaunch a new VM.
pros_cons: ["IT admin has complete control over these VMs through ESXi as well as being able to release a new VM if the prior VM system has any issue, this saves hundreds of hours for our admins.","Using ESXi together with VCenter is a great platform for maintaining the VMs, virtual networks, building datacenters, and tracking what is going on with our VMs.","ESXi that I had set up as a lab to learn from and to teach others off of saved our entire network from a serious hack out of China. When I set up this ESXi as a learning platform I set it in a way that it was the main point of our network (by accident) this accident stopped a brute force attack that was done through a 3 day weekend with over thousands of attempts to hack into. They only got into a BS VM that was set for learning. This saved us a lot of money and embarrassment."]

review_title: Webroot - Best Anti-Virus for Businesses
usecases_deployment_scope: It is being used on workstations across our entire organization. It was used more in depth at my previous employer(MSP) and is where I interacted with it the most. We were able to silently install on computers that were missing Webroot which could automatically license and poll to the cloud. This was great in the fact that we didn't have to big the end user, we just had to wait for it to show in the cloud admin console. As an admin you have complete control and can even go as far as to not allow the end user to open and see the Webroot client interface. Since we had an overview of all Webroot clients from the cloud, we were able to proactively see viruses or threats before they caused major harm on the computer. As for the servers you were able to turn off certain features if you felt it would interfere with the performance or programs running on them. There are some helpful tools that you can use if the client is on a workstation. For example you can send a command to reboot the computer with no interaction. It runs mostly on it's own and is my favorite Antivirus to use.
likelihood_to_recommend: It works well for the company and love that it is centrally managed on the web. Being able to create policies and assign per individuals Webroot client is awesome. So easy to use and the support is awesome!

There is now an electricity and excitement when associates hear about all of the different ways their departments can organize, standardize, and streamline their work flows. When department leaders start looking into ways to increase efficiencies and transparency within their department as well as with other departments, Wrike is always in those discussions. review_title: ZipRecruiter- A Review

When it comes to more senior roles, because it's incredibly easy for anyone to apply, it's time-consuming and difficult to find a "needle in a haystack" for an open position.
pros_cons: ["ZipRecruiter is very easy to use, even for those who are not tech-savvy.","The platform offers seamless options to mass-message out all candidates who have applied. This eliminates the time-consuming efforts to have to message out to each candidate.","ZipRecruiter parses and connects well with our ATS platform, which makes it easy to track information as well and manage candidate profiles."]

review_title: Mostly Useless
usecases_deployment_scope: Used to bolster sourcing efforts for a number of positions across a number of industries. ZipRecruiter was used as a supplement to additional recruiting tools, including Indeed, LinkedIn, and Career Builder. We did not use all the features of ZipRecruiter (though I have used all features with previous positions), and primarily utilized the resume database to source for passive candidates.
likelihood_to_recommend: ZipRecruiter has in my experience always been much more practical for sourcing for lower-level, lower-paying roles. If you need to find general labor candidates, customer service personnel, etc., ZipRecruiter can really improve your resume count. However, if you are recruiting for technical or high-level positions, ZipRecruiter falls way short of competitors like LinkedIn Recruiter.

ZipRecruiter typically had some new candidates to bring into the mix.","Easy candidate ratings. Trying to use a numerical scale can be clumsy. Most recruiting platforms provide this feature in their resume database, but it still warrants mention here."]

review_title: Tipalti Review

In addition, it flags duplicate bills and scans invoices to cut down on time coding bills. Lastly, it syncs with NetSuite allowing us to skip more uploads. I am still learning more about Tipalti so I am sure there are much more benefits to be learned.

Lastly, there are many reports you can run providing you will very informational data in seconds.

Tipalti Manually syncs bills that have been approved. Once a bill is approved it will be in our ERP 15 minutes after.","Filters. There are many filters you can customize and use which will help show the bills you are looking for. When you are a large company like us and see thousands of bills, filters are crucial.","Image swap, and image swap feature would be amazing and help save time. For example, if you have an office change and process a bill addressed to an old office and it was already approved. You could swap the image of the new invoice address to the new office instead of having to delete and reprocess the invoice.","Sync errors, I think all sync error titles should be stated. I should never have to reach out to Tipalti support just to find out what the error is and then have to try and fix it. To me this is time consuming for no reason.","During pay runs if the check box would be a little bit bigger or if you mis click by it then it not open the invoice. review_title: Great for collaboration and communication
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Miro both at individual and team levels, as a thought aid and a collaboration tool, to understand, discuss, and communicate complex relations between concepts. We have used it to ideate new products and features, map workflows and processes, and generate mock-ups, graphs and charts for presentations. It is a great help in giving structure to otherwise disperse discussions: it helps make concepts visible and tangible, so that different stakeholders can contribute to building a shared understanding. The capabilities of Miro as a virtual whiteboard; It enables creating objects and relations in a very similar way as, if meeting in person, you would gather around a physical whiteboard and draw or move sticky notes around, to help visualise the concepts that you are speaking about and get everyone on the same page, instead of having each person hold their own perspective on their heads. Thus, it provides a very close experience to that of a physical whiteboard.
likelihood_to_recommend: Good tool for collaborative sense-making and ideation. It helps map and communicate concepts and relations. The infinite canvas, the ability to drop images, draw links, etc. help create charts and graphs faster than with any other tool I have tried.   Not so good as a tool for planning and productivity. In my opinion, there are better alternatives, where you can specify defaults, automated rules, etc. For example, Miro offers templates that mimic planning tools like Gantt charts, Kanban boards, etc. However, this is a superficial implementation. While you can make it look as one of those planning tools, every element needs to be created manually: you cannot set up smart rules or automation, as you can with specialised planning software (e.g. Trello or Asana). Thus, for those use cases I still prefer to use those specialised tools.
pros_cons: ["Mind maps","Affinity diagrams","Flow charts"]

review_title: Cisco ThousandEyes review
usecases_deployment_scope: Used to monitor our network. We have it integrated with Webex to alerts which cover our network and collaboration endpoints. Using the agent to monitor remoted users connections is extremely helpful to determine if any issues are due to the remote workers home internet or network. We also use the Cisco ThousandEyes agent to monitor workstations or servers to troubleshoot any issues that occur. It's a great tool for network monitoring and helps us find the causes of any network issues a lot faster than traditional troubleshooting. It's also a great tool for monitoring from data center to data center and ISP connections. If you are wanting a tool that covers monitoring for your entire network then this is a great tool. It's also good for monitoring Cisco's entire sweet of collaboration tools, including Webex. There are many easy to read and use dashboards and to setup the agent and monitoring is pretty straightforward. We use Cisco ThousandEyes daily to monitor. We continue to find new monitoring uses reasons and so far are really happy with what this tool brings to our organization. In a lot of cases it allows us to be more proactive than reactive. Allowing our network team to remedy issues before end users even notice them.
likelihood_to_recommend: It's a great tool for monitoring remote workers' connections. Great for monitoring the overall network. Routers, switches, collaboration, Cisco video endpoints, Great alerting tool that is built into Webex so that you receive alerts as things in your network happen. Great for monitoring connection to servers when you believe there could be latency or other issues.

review_title: Save Time & Keep Salesforce Data Clean with Cloudingo
usecases_deployment_scope: Having clean and up-to-date data in your CRM is extremely important. Cloudingo is used in our sales and marketing departments to... 1) Merge duplicate records 2) Ensure leads are converted to contacts to the appropriate account. Rather than having to manually guess and search for "dirty" data in Salesforce, Cloudingo allows our teams to see the quality of the data in our CRM in a single dashboard view, and also allows us to merge and convert records individually or in groups. Cloudingo helps keep our CRM clean so the rest of the work we do isn't wasted on "dirty" or out-dated data.
likelihood_to_recommend: Cloudingo is a Salesforce deduping and cleaning tool. I highly recommend that someone in your company who works with Salesforce data also work within Cloudingo. review_title: Don't use AppFolio Property Manager for property-management software!
usecases_deployment_scope: We use AppFolio Property Manager in all aspects of our property management business. From advertising properties, keeping track of prospects, running applications, executing leases, collecting rent and receiving communication from residents, submission, assigning and tracking of work orders, entry and payment of bills, accounting to residents, vendors and property owners, income statements to owners
likelihood_to_recommend: The AppFolio Property Manager App is user friendly and easy to use. The receipt and recording of rents is apt as is the work order flow. When we signed up for AppFolio Property Manager we communicated to every point of contact from the sales agent to the implementation team, that our revenue model stems from marking up bills and services 10%.  Everyone told us repeatedly that this was EASILY accomplished through AppFolio Property Manager.  Once we spent thousands of dollars and hundreds of hours on implementation, we now realize that those representations were, in my opinion, false.  In our old software, markups could be accomplished at the bill level (click a button for markup or discount and input the percentage). In my experience in AppFolio Property Manager, to mark up a bill or service, numerous steps are required. First you must create a work order where detailed information must be input (who creates a work order for a home-depot bill?); close the work order and then go to the work order page, select the work order and "create bill" from the work order; enter all the same detailed information plus additional information; mark up the bill and save; then go to payables, insert bank account and vendor to find the bill - then pay the bill. In my experience when entering 100 home-depot charges on the other software, we would go to vendor, select "mark up" and the percentage, then enter the 100 charges by property; save the bill and then pay it.  This might take 20 minutes.  In our experience in AppFolio Property Manager, for us to make our profit which enables us to stay in business and pay our AppFolio Property Manager fees, rent, payroll etc., we have to spend ALL DAY creating work orders for every separate home-depot charge and then hop through all of the other hoops and do it 99 other times. My entire office is so frustrated and we cannot focus on marketing, leasing, work orders or getting new business because we are spending all day jumping through all of these hoops to achieve our mark up. In our experience, we reach out to customer service again and again and are only answered by bots.  The bots are no help so our issue escalates to a real person. The person is no help and escalates the issue.  Ive been told 10 times that i will receive an emailed answer to my question - but no email has arrived and our issue remains unaddressed. In our experience, we are then pointed to "suggestion boards" where there is nothing but dissatisfied AppFolio Property Manager customers who are not receiving answers to their issues.  To say that we have buyers remorse is an understatement
pros_cons: ["track rent charges and tenant receipts","resident work orders","marketing of properties"]

review_title: Azure Cost Benefit Analysis
usecases_deployment_scope: We were looking to expand our operations adding new functionality which would cause tremendous strain on our existing servers. The web and worker roles were the perfect solution, allowing us to develop a front end application tied to SQL Azure and an Azure Service bus which would relay data and messages to the back end worker role. The processing jobs could take over 10 hours of hard computing, so off loading this work was imperative. Azure gave us an inexpensive, robust, and immediately scalable solution to make this happen.
likelihood_to_recommend: Cloud hosting is typically more expensive than hosting a physical box yourself. For this reason, the key aspects to consider are:Can you host the solution yourself? If your company has the manpower and resources to host and support servers, then this is typically going to be the less expensive path in the long term with a much higher up front setup cost. Azure is the right solution for anyone looking to offset high initial server cost in favor of low recurring monthly payments until the project begins to draw in revenue.Should you host the solution yourself? Hosting your own physical box requires a lot of planning and disaster recovery forethought which Azure takes out of the equation. Again, if your company lacks the resources/manpower to manage these tasks, Azure is the right solution for you.Is the projects success guaranteed? Even if your company does have the resources to host your own servers, Azure gets you to market faster than hosting your own box. If the project becomes successful, you can always fall back to local hosting and use Azure for disaster recovery.

This lets them have great creative freedom and piece together assets that cover the brief, however the huge amount of variety means they have to be specific when looking for assets, as the brief they're given doesn't always match up with the images chosen- however this is more user error and learning than the product itself.

review_title: The easiest and most user friendly virtual phone system
usecases_deployment_scope: Grasshopper is a great way to manage calls coming in. You can set up extensions for different departments, say sales, billing, and tech support. After working with a client, if they call back and go to billing or support, I know what they are calling for beforehand. Same with a new client or prospect, I will know before taking the call. It helps manage surprise calls better.
likelihood_to_recommend: Grasshopper is great for small businesses, startups, e-commerce businesses--anyone getting their business started and needing something very functional and effective to manage communications. You can get a new number from them--vanity, toll-free numbers too. And when you want to take a day off and go on vacation, they have a cool vacation mode feature (I think it's just muting or send calls directly to voicemail).
pros_cons: ["Mobile app and desktop app","Converts your voicemails to text to read on a phone or desktop","Great custom auto-attendant feature","I'd love to see a 14-, 21-, or even 30-day trial"]

review_title: Great platform to house all of our online trainings.
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Absorb LMS in our organization for all external and online internal trainings we have. This includes mandatory federal compliance training, safety trainings for construction, and quick how to videos. We also have everyone complete onboarding trainings through our Absorb LMS. Absorb LMS addresses the problem of where to house all of the online trainings we offer. Absorb LMS also makes it easy to inegrate with third party vendors, so we can get the best trainings from various resources. We do not use Absorb LMS for any in-person trainings that we hold.
likelihood_to_recommend: Absorb LMS is a great place to house online trainings that are both required or voluntary. Absorb LMS allows us to add third party courses, as well as, courses we build in-house and share them in one spot for our users to access. Absorb LMS also helps track course completions whether we need to know whose taken a course for compliance reasons or we are needing to do a training report for the company as a whole. Absorb LMS hasn't been useful for tracking or adding information for in-person trainings.

review_title: Successful first LMS for our Company
usecases_deployment_scope: Our company implemented Absorb LMS less than a year ago as our company's first-ever LMS. We reviewed several LMS systems and found that Absorb offered the features that we desired at a lower cost than other competitors. Prior to adopting an LMS, our training courses and records were decentralized and difficult to manage. Many of our prior training materials were PowerPoint presentations and not interactive for the audience. Adopting Absorb's LMS allowed us to centralize training records, provided easier access to training on-demand, and provided a more modern platform using video-based training. We were also able to create custom content with quizzes to confirm that learning objectives were met. Having the training records centralized in the LMS enabled our company to more efficiently confirm competency requirements for various industry and customer audits. We were much more efficient in transitioning repetitive training that had been instructor-led to video-based.
likelihood_to_recommend: Absorb is a great LMS for most applications.  It was fairly easy to learn to configure and looks very professional.  Our employees adopted the system fairly quickly and we had mostly positive feedback.  The base Absorb platform provides basic reporting, so if you are going to need more customized reporting, then you will need to purchase the additional module for Absorb Analyze.  The Manager Experience is still evolving, and managers may want to have more ability to do things in this part of the system than what is currently available.  There is a connector that can be purchased from ADP to connect it with Absorb's LMS, although our company chose to develop our own API connector.  We are currently using third-party course authoring software.  The Absorb Amplify courses are good if you want to add immediate content to the system, although the courses are very basic.

review_title: Dice TalentSearch the Mass

We can also manage the accounting if you have entities at different locations by using the feature of location. We can also download the report by using the filter option. We can also integrate the QuickBooks Desktop with third party application here we have connected with Bill.com, QuickBase and other application by using its API.

I can reach out to my PM at any time and if she is out for any reason, their team will jump in to help. No software is perfect, they are always changing and evolving. usecases_deployment_scope: As a partner we train our people and give demos to our clients as well. We also do the implementation for our clients.
likelihood_to_recommend: SAP S/4HANA Cloud is well suited for analytics. I don't know where it would be less appropriate.

review_title: Zoho, why waste company time; when you could be making more dime!
usecases_deployment_scope: My business locates Natural Gas for all of the north western portion of Indiana probably about a 3 hour x 3 hours driving distance span and only have 1 HQ office and 1 in construction spaced out to support our company. With that comes the complications of having to hire people hours away from us that will be reliable and able to perform their job duties in their area of the state without meeting with other employees face to face for days to weeks. Since we are not able to travel most of our applicants due to this using this software allows us to pull applications from all the cities hours away that are expanding and sort and borrow down a select list for each location based on skills and key component's that we select AND it even streamlines the process by after they are selected then going ahead and helping both us and them connect, set up and interview, and even onto the hiring process all in one package without even needing to meet face to face or worry about making appointments and taking extra company time to do a lot of the hiring process.
likelihood_to_recommend: With the business I am in I have to be able to search and reach potential candidates from hours away due to the scope of the contract we have covering a solid couple hundred sq. miles of the state; so being able to have a software that can search, sort, rank, and suggest candidates without having to spend ours of time or driving hours for an interview I can connect with one person and make a decision and have the software there for them and send an email or two with the steps and instructions and 5 minutes later be doing the same for another candidate hours away without even needing to leave the office or even from home and knowing that I'm able to monitor and adjust the steps or make adjustments along the way and being able to trust that it is choosing quality candidates and able to help me hire the right people to do my job to keep my contractors and homeowners safe is amazing for our business.

review_title: BizNet Excel Suite is a user-friendly and full functional reporting tool
usecases_deployment_scope: We purchased the Epicor XL Connect version of BizInsight as a replacement for FRx. We will be making the switch for financial reporting using XL Connect in the very near future, and will use it to report to our entire organization. As an Excel add-on, the product has a more familiar feel to users than our previous reporting software. The ability to use native Excel functions makes the possibilities endless.
likelihood_to_recommend: BizNet would be a welcome addition to any organization that is familiar with Excel and needs to connect to their ERP.

product_name: IDrive Online Backup and Object Storage e2
review_title: It gets the job done
usecases_deployment_scope: I use IDrive Online Backup and Object Storage e2 as my cloud backup for my (Apple Silicon) MacBook Pro. I am a firm believer in having offsite/cloud as well as onsite backup for redundancy and speed of restores from archive.  My use case covers my individual machine which has my open source projects as well as my personal data.
likelihood_to_recommend: As part of a 3-2-1 backup strategy on MacOS - (3 forms of backup, at least 2 different technologies, and at least 1 offsite), IDrive Online Backup and Object Storage e2 works great in tandem with my TimeMachine and DropBox backups.  It backs up any mounted volumes.  Archiving (for history vs. just the most recent copy) is, like TimeMachine, invaluable, as often you don't need the most recent copy (which might be bad) but a previous one.  The interaction with DropBox wasn't perfect: my Documents and Downloads are DropBox monitored, which means that they are symbolic links to my DropBox folder.  After the initial install, those links were NOT followed and so IDrive Online Backup and Object Storage e2 was not backing up those areas, which was not what I expected.  Luckily I scrutinized the backup areas, and what was stored in the online web interface, and did a sample restore. Also, I use Quicken for MacOS which stores my datafiles in my '~/Library/Application Support' directory; by default that area is NOT monitored by IDrive Online Backup and Object Storage e2 either.  So my advice is: after the install configures its defaults, review it very carefully to make sure your data is covered properly.  Easy to install, easy to setup (other than my earlier gripes about the UX), easy to test.  The shortcomings in monitored folders just requires diligence.

review_title: Jobvite is a great time-saver with all of its automation capabilities!
usecases_deployment_scope: Our company experienced rapid growth and we needed an ATS that could keep up with our needs. Jobvite allows for a great deal of customization that we couldn't find with any other applicant tracking systems. Being able to tailor this software to our needs has allowed us to automate several administrative tasks that we big time wasters for us before. Jobvite has been a life-saver. We have a small talent acquisition staff that manages all of our positions and time is a very valuable resource for us.
likelihood_to_recommend: This software is amazing if you take the time to set things up and make it work the right way for your company.  If you are expecting a plug-and-play software, Jobvite is not for you.    The auto-scheduling feature is amazing!  I can request availability from a candidate, have them respond, and have the system automatically schedule the interview all within a minute.  It makes it so easy and keeps things organized.

review_title: SharePoint: an untapped collaborative resource
usecases_deployment_scope: I've used SharePoint at my previous employer and now here at Signode. We are still getting acclimated to all its capabilities and are rather low on the maturity model of full blown adoption, but are increasingly leveraging its team collaboration capabilities (beyond just thinking of the platform as a collection of department shared drives.) We are using the platform primarily intra-departmentally, but also globally for company wide communications. We have yet to fully incorporate the advantages of workflows, but I'm hopeful we can begin to leverage this time-saving capability within the next 6-12 months. I personally use OneDrive via my SharePoint portal for ALL document storage and house nothing on my C:/. I can get to all my documents anytime, anywhere from any web capable device and OneDrive removes my worry of data loss.
likelihood_to_recommend: It's definitely a powerhouse as an intranet site. We do not yet know how to fully incorporate it such that our home page is dynamic and a desired landing place for all our users, but that is on the horizon. I think Microsoft can improve on the idea of SharePoint "Apps" and make these easier to jump in and out of.

review_title: Dropbox is better than other competition that exists!
usecases_deployment_scope: We currently use dropbox for maintaining and storing our creative and video files. The files consist of large design files from indesign, photoshop, illustrator. We used a different cloud service, that service was subpar. It didn't provide the ease of storage and sharing the files like Dropbox allows us to use it for.
likelihood_to_recommend: We used a different cloud service and was extremely disappointed that it didn't always upload all of the files as it should have. Dropbox doesn't have any issues with uploading many files at once. Dropbox is also handy because it provides ample storage that allows us to not be concerned about file size.

review_title: Visualize the data that matters - for free!
usecases_deployment_scope: Google Data Studio is solely being used by myself to present data and statistics mainly for marketing presentations within the organization, but also for external use when presenting to potential and current clients. Using the platform helps our organization to use data to make strategic marketing decisions, share real-time data with other employees, and communicate product value to our audience.
likelihood_to_recommend: I would recommend Google Data Studio to a colleague who works for a larger company with robust marketing and IT teams. The platform could be overwhelming for smaller teams and would be more effectively used by professionals with experience in analytics, marketing, and web development. The ROI would be quite low if used in smaller businesses.
pros_cons: ["Google Data Studio is great for companies who need to keep track of data that is constantly changing. For example, my organization uses it to track click-through rates in our PPC campaigns. In Data Studio, we can add a “running calculation” of click-through rates as the campaign goes on and the graph displaying the campaign results will continuously change to reflect the most current interactions.","Google Data Studio has saved the marketing team time while enabling us to effortlessly improve communication with other departments. We often create PPC Campaigns for other departments like our training team who needs us to promote their training sessions and webinars. Rather than constantly exporting data and creating new graphs like we’ve done in the past to provide updates, we can set up Data Studio to continuously pull data from our Google AdWords Campaigns or Facebook Campaigns and automatically update the graphs. Since we can also create a shareable link to these graphs, any department we create campaigns for can see real-time campaign results and quickly understand whether potential clients are engaging with the content or not.","Google Data Studio is great for displaying data that comes from multiple places. Like most marketing teams, we have data from social media accounts, Google Analytics data measuring our web traffic, email click-through rates, etc. In the past, I’ve had to merge data into one application before I could even begin to make a graph. In Google Data Studio, almost every platform is compatible and data can be automatically fed into the graphs you create on the platform."]

usecases_deployment_scope: Microsoft Office is used all across the organization in every department. It has so many options and functions that can make a simple spreadsheet work wonders. I can't seem to find any scenarios where it's less appropriate. Working as a developer with Excel is just great and having the ability to automate tedious repetitive work easily is the best.

For example, creating different documents with Word by using Excel databases is really easy and consumes almost no time at all."]

usecases_deployment_scope: I am the IT project manager for the company I work for and I live and breathe Microsoft Project. review_title: The greatest choice you'll ever make!!
usecases_deployment_scope: We are using MIP for our corporate and line of business accounting needs. It is only being utilized by the accounting department at this time. It helps us tremendously by letting us account for our lines of business individually, and the entire corporation as well. This allows us to analyze our various lines of business for efficiency and effectiveness.

The other thing that 365 addresses is a collaboration between HW and SW engineers. Conveniently, we can look at the exact schematics simultaneously on the web. Every change I made appears directly on Altium 365.
likelihood_to_recommend: Azure DevOps ServerAltium 365 is way better.
pros_cons: ["Easy access to the design by every team member.","Reviewing with comments on the design is particularly very helpful.","Graphical interface."]

review_title: A Powerful Tool for Developing Micro-Services Rapidly
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Amazon API Gateway in conjunction with AWS Lambda functions and the Serverless framework to rapidly build microservices. This combination is very powerful, particularly for small development teams, because it allows us to delegate work to AWS; we can focus our development effort only on features that yield competitive advantages for our business.
likelihood_to_recommend: Amazon API Gateway is a very powerful tool, particularly for small engineering teams. It is ideal for rapidly developing microservices when used in conjunction with the Serverless framework and AWS Lambda. It is also great when used as a conventional API gateway that provides authentication and routing over microservices. It would not be useful for exposing a monolithic application.
pros_cons: ["API Gateway integrates well with AWS Lambda. This allows us to build a web server in the language and framework of our choice, deploy it as a Lambda function, and expose it through API Gateway.","API Gateway manages API keys. Building rate limiting and request quota features are not trivial (or interesting).","API Gateway's pricing can be very attractive for services that are accessed infrequently."]

review_title: Lets build a deployment with zero downtime with AWS EC2 Auto Scaling
usecases_deployment_scope: We are using AWS EC2 for most of our server requirements. Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling service improves the use of AWS EC2. It automatically replaces the instances with bad health conditions, it allows to sleep a server when there are low loads, etc. The main function of AWS EC2 Auto Scaling is that it saves us from any unpredictable server breakdowns by scaling the servers according to the requirements.
likelihood_to_recommend: AWS EC2 Auto Scaling is well suited for you if you are using AWS EC2 instances for your deployment requirements and you want to build an auto-scaling solution. If you do not want to break down your deployment in between, you should set up the auto-scaling along with the load balancers.
pros_cons: ["It doesn't require any monitoring or manual changes.","It automatically scale up the infrastructure whenever required.","It put the extra instances on sleep in case of the reduced load to save money and electricity.","It replaces the instances automatically in case of bad health conditions."]

review_title: What to expect from Route 53
usecases_deployment_scope: I have worked with AWS Route 53 in all the three of my Organizations in which I worked. Route 53 plays major role when it comes to create and serve the Website all over the world for DNS when created through Amazon web services also when you are website is hosted in less popular cloud providers. One best thing is we can use Route 53 service alone from AWS even though our website is hosted in any other Cloud Service Provider. And, as usual route 53 offers all types of Routing type which you can expect of also the cost is competitive for the scale it provides. The main reason for backing up this service as per my advice it would be it interacts with anything service provider and setting up is kinda of easy also there isn't negligible downtime.
likelihood_to_recommend: When you want the setup of DNS and domain registration to be done in couple of hours this will be the first place to go also the main reason for supporting the Route 53 service will be its integration with other AWS services should has CloudFront and SES services. With Route 53 and CloudFront combined you can have two layer of protection to your systems which will be one big thing when you see in terms of Cyber attacks.
pros_cons: ["We can purchase our domain through Route 53 and can be hosted for cheaper prices in AWS.","There are many number of routing policies you can go ahead with and this will come into picture when the customer satisfaction is required at most, so choose routing policy accordingly.","As usual health checks are part of DNS systems, this is also provided at cheaper rates when total process is done in Route 53 service.","It can be used as standalone application from AWS"]

review_title: Amazon Route 53: A DNS database, fast
usecases_deployment_scope: Route 53 means the automation of a lot of stuff we did manually before. It's used by our Infrastructure team and some other small teams when in development. The business problems that it solves were related to speed in new deployments of entries, change entries, set up new domains, and being faster than before.
likelihood_to_recommend: Amazon Route 53 is very good if your team is big or small. For a single person to manage it, if you know what are you doing, you'll notice that it is faster than BIND to manage, for example, no need to add a serial number, and edit entries are also very fast. The only scenario where I think it's less appropriate is when you don't want to spend money dealing with DNS. But, even in that, the price of a single machine is not cheaper than to set up an AWS account and a new DNS zone.
pros_cons: ["Web interface","The many options to set up new entries","Fast, really fast","No more editing files","Add not only domain zones but domain names"]

review_title: True to its title: 'Simple' Email Service
usecases_deployment_scope: Amazon SES is currently being used by our team (Mobile/ IoT) to send customized emails to users in reaction to events.
likelihood_to_recommend: It is best suited for sending customized emails to users in reaction to events from other AWS services.It is less appropriate for just sending out notification emails in which case SNS should be used.
pros_cons: ["It provides a simple syntax to create templates for customized emails","It has a great rate limit once moved out of the sandbox","Nice mechanisms to handle bounce and replies"]

review_title: Amplitude Analytics
usecases_deployment_scope: Amplitude Analytics is good application for cross platform user journey tracking. It goes beyond just page views and click rate. We use this application to analyze questions like which activities keep user coming back? Impact of any update on user interaction? Good thing about amplitude is it not only support web analytics but can also be used for mobile analytics.
likelihood_to_recommend: If your company use multiple digital platforms to interact with customers, Amplitude Analytics is a good way to track their journey. It is quite helpful to identify drops, missed opportunity and looking at customer journey
pros_cons: ["User behavioral analysis","Web analytics","Cross platform journey tracking"]

review_title: Anaconda - The tool to master for Python based data analytic tasks
usecases_deployment_scope: The data science and operation research team in our company majorly uses Python as the programming language. So Anaconda was chosen to provide one research platform, allowing the data scientists to work on one unified environment, across different OS, using the same language while being able to share the work progress as well as results and promote the team efforts.
likelihood_to_recommend: Anaconda is very suitable for a research team/lab/department which has many data scientists who want to apply some Python-based analytic programming and want to cooperate in sharing the results easily. It is not very well suited for final production environment deployment.
pros_cons: ["Anaconda itself already carries the most popular Python packages so for most developers it is sufficient enough to deal with the normal work requirements.","The Jupyter Notebook is a very encouraging feature which allows the researcher to apply the data analysis in an intuitive way. It provides step by step understanding the data, processing the data, visualizing the data and trying out the different methodology and algorithm","Both the old version of Python and the new version of Python are supported, giving a very good backward compatibility of some old Python codes developed beforehand."]

review_title: ARD, Essential for Apple Environments
usecases_deployment_scope: ARD is being used by technology support staff in our organization to manage Apple desktops and laptops in our organization. It can collect stats from our endpoints and can run UNIX scripts in the background, this is especially helpful if we need to silently push an update or get information about the usage of a computer behind the scenes so to speak. We use this throughout our organization and not a day goes by when I do not use it.
likelihood_to_recommend: If you are in an environment where you are supporting 10+ macOS desktops/laptops you need this product. It is great for Education and Education Management.If you are not a technical support person, this software is not for you, if you don't do IT work in your org, this is not for you. In my opinion, any org that has less than 10 macOS machines does not need this product.
pros_cons: ["Allows us to execute UNIX scripts without alerting a user or interrupting their workflow.","Allows us to observe, control, and share control of a user's machine flawlessly.","Enables us to collect usage statistics from endpoints to determine machine usage and this, in turn, helps drive business decisions."]

review_title: Process Mapping/Documentation Platform with Good Features and Ease of Use
usecases_deployment_scope: It was used to lead the digital transformation of our company, selected and disseminated by digital transformation directorate. The idea was, in our 70 years of organization, almost all processes were knowledge-based, and they were transferred from senior engineer to junior engineer in an oral and experimental way as juniors learned how to carry out business processes they work. The issue was they were dependent on people and were not written or kept in a process map so that anyone could read it. In order to document all of our company's processes and be able to see the ones open to improvement and document them, we ran a program to teach ARIS, disseminate ARIS and make people document all their processes.
likelihood_to_recommend: In case you have a LOT of processes and know-how of these processes are not documented, thus making your company depend on specific people, ARIS is a good tool to document processes that manage complex relationships between functions, people, IT systems, input and output documents, and scenarios. It is also good for reporting, for example, once you complete documenting all your processes, you can simply get a response to "in what processes is Excel used?" because ARIS will give you just that, and is capable of more.
pros_cons: ["Process documentation","Process mapping"]

review_title: Arena: Awesome Robust Effective Necessary Amazing tool for Product Management
usecases_deployment_scope: Arena is being used for Document and version control for all our Major documents such as Business Requirement Document, Engineering Requirement Document, and many more. Arena is also used for our Production Control, where we manage the Complete Life cycle of the product from Production to End Of Life. It is being used by All departments such as Product Management, Program Management, Engineering, etc.Arena helped in solving the problem of keeping a track record, which is a challenging task. Also, it helps in knowledge transfer with the right documentation in place. For example, if any important person leaves the organization without knowledge transfer, this tool with the right documentation helps in keeping a record of it and can be used as a source to learn the task which was left by the person leaving. Arena is indeed the best tool for Quality Control, Version Control, and others for Document or Product.
likelihood_to_recommend: Arena is very helpful for Product management related aspects such as Market requirement update and New product Introduction. This also helps in keeping a record of the market decks, such as the quick installation guide. It is also helpful in updating the BOM easily without any efforts and helps in keeping a track record of any changes made.
pros_cons: ["Arena helped in solving the problem of keeping a track record, which is a challenging task.","Also, it helps in knowledge transfer with the right documentation in place, for example, if any important person leaves the organization without knowledge transfer.","Arena has also helped in achieving ISO certification.","It is also helpful in updating the BOM easily without much efforts and helps in keeping a track record of any changes made."]

review_title: Arena as a true PLM tool
usecases_deployment_scope: Being utilized by 100 internal users by a hardware department and 150 supplier users.
likelihood_to_recommend: Scalable and integration with ERP, MCAD, ECAD and other API is a plus for Arena.
pros_cons: ["Easy configuration.","Easy promote links between request and change.","Easy BOM views and APIs.","Easy to setup routings.","Arena Winter training was informative and helped users prepare."]

review_title: Articulate 360 is a robust online training creation package
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Articulate 360 to build training content for our global training organization. We create online training modules using Storyline and Rise and send them for review via Review 360.
likelihood_to_recommend: Articulate 360 is a full-featured suite of online training and development tools. It would be a great fit for any organization with instructional designers that create online training covering anything from soft-skills, to software demonstrations. They have tools and capabilities to cover most online training needs.  It wouldn't be as well suited for an organization that did mostly classroom training.
pros_cons: ["Articulate 360 provides a complete suite of tools needed for creating and delivering online content. They include tools for the creation of online training with resources such as audio, video, and sound files to use in your presentations, and a review tool that makes it simple to gather feedback in a single location from stakeholders.","Articulate 360 has an incredibly supportive community of developer and employees. You can often get an answer to your questions within a few hours by posting on their public forums. They have employees that work those queues, but a lot of times, the questions get answers by the very active user community before the employees can get to your question!","Articulate 360 tools are being updated regularly with new features that keep them on the cutting edge and at the front of the eLearning development tools vendors. They listen to their users and create features that solve the most common obstacles and streamline the most common tasks."]

review_title: Articulate Storyline 2
usecases_deployment_scope: Used to create e-learning content.
likelihood_to_recommend: I give Articulate a high recommendation. It's easy to use and quite serviceable. Occupies the same authoring space as Lectora. Storyline and Lectora are the only two e-learning authoring tools I would recommend. There are some well-known "Brand X" tools I'd recommend staying away from (but I'm not going to put specific names in print, sorry).
pros_cons: ["Allows courseware creator to manage the flow of the participant by using variables.","Embedded and online media","Customizable size of stage."]

review_title: Relatively easy to learn.
usecases_deployment_scope: athenaClinicals is a lightweight interface that is easy to navigate.The problem list is easy to find, and adding documentation in the appropriate areas is intuitive.The scheduling software included functions nicely for an office practice.
likelihood_to_recommend: Works well for family med and peds primary care. Would not be well suited to wound healing/hyperbaric medicine practice in current configuration as the specific documentation requirements of wound management and hyperbaric treatments don't mesh well with the layout and forms that I observed.
pros_cons: ["athenaClinicals is a lightweight interface that is easy to navigate.","The problem list is easy to find, and adding documentation in the appropriate areas is intuitive.","The scheduling software included functions nicely for an office practice."]

review_title: Great Chat Platform, It Will Be Missed
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Stride as our main chat communication platform across our company. We moved to Stride from Atlasian's previous chat software, HipChat, and were pleased with the upgrades brought to the platform. Stride is easy to use, and works across most platforms. It has many integrations with other software and services.Unfortunately, Stride is going away as of Feb 15th and all users are being sent over to Slack. Slack, a former competitor, is a solid platform with tons of integrations.
likelihood_to_recommend: Slack, PhpStorm, OneNote
pros_cons: ["Great group messaging with rooms","Integrations for other software is very helpful.","Finding people in the organisation is very easy with the directory feature","Built in Meetings function is so helpful"]

review_title: Tinkercad, Great for new CAD users and Classrooms!
usecases_deployment_scope: I have implemented Tinkercad in my classroom and train around Thirty-Six students every six months. I introduce reductive and additive sculpture, as well as 3D printing concepts in my training program. I use the projects provided by Tinkercad to reinforce the training program I have created to introduce the program. Most users have no CAD experience at the start and can create complex forms after two weeks.
likelihood_to_recommend: Tinkercad is such a great program and I would recommend the program to anyone who wants an introduction to a simple CAD program. I have another colleague that is now using it in her classroom due to my recommendation. I have had students start with me in Tinkercad and eventually work their way up in skill and purchase other Autodesk products because of the enjoyment and opportunity that Tinkercad provided.
pros_cons: ["Tinkercad is a great baseline CAD program. This program is easy to implement and train people in.","After on a short period of time my students are able to create complex forms using Tinkercads pre-generated shapes and holes.","The Tinkercad provided projects aid in pushing the learning experience even further and reinforce the ideas that I train on and help my students explore the program before designing their own complex sculptural forms."]

review_title: Aviso - manage and forecast sales numbers all in one screen!
usecases_deployment_scope: Being a sales organization, we are driven by numbers. Aviso lets us gain insights on how we are doing as a team and how we are projected to end at the end of a sales month/quarter/year. It gives us visibility on deals we are working on by having it integrated with our CRM solution, therefore allowing us to see which deals needs more priority in terms of efforts put it and how we can propel them to the next stage.
likelihood_to_recommend: Positive impact: better visibility on the stages of our deals, more accurate forecasting of sales numbers.Negative impact: we have another tool to use together with our CRM instead of keeping it all in one place.
pros_cons: ["It is very accurate in predicting the outcome of our sales numbers.","It is useful when doing deal reviews with our sales agents, we can see which deals are needed to prioritize and our next action item.","It integrates seamlessly with our CRM, it pulls data from it that we use for deal and pipeline reviews."]

review_title: Atlassian Confluence is a great tool for documentation and integration into Jira Service Desk and Software apps
usecases_deployment_scope: Confluence is a great application for logging documentation in a centralized location. It has a lot of capabilities that are useful. Using Confluence by itself just seems wrong though, it works so well with the other applications by Atlassian, such as Software or Service Desk. The integration between these applications is really nice and is enough to overlook some of the downsides of the products.
likelihood_to_recommend: The Service Desk utilizes the Confluence sections where access has been granted for customer visibility so that when they are looking to submit a ticket, it gives recommended solutions prior to submitting the ticket.  Also, from the agent side on the Service Desk, they will be giving a few possible solution documents to the ticket in question.  We have not built out our documentation that much, but I can see this being EXTREMELY helpful for troubleshooting tickets.
pros_cons: ["Allows for a simple and organized layout of documentation and instructions.","Very flexible layouts with many different features that you can add to the pages. You can also customize the look and feel of the pages."]

review_title: A good platform with data integrity and quality at the forefront!
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Azure Data Catalog in our organization to solve data collection and conduct thematic audits of data modules. We use the platform to quantify data first and then find structures or common themes to derive actionable reports for our quarter-end efforts. The scope is strictly internal for now but in the future, we want to roll out the solution for clients as well.
likelihood_to_recommend: It is great for teams to get started and get an established process onboarded across the organization. But I feel as teams and organizational practices evolve, a more robust tool like AWS is better suited. In my personal experience. I also feel there could have been a better knowledge library or community established (for example Salesforce community) to engage with current users and troubleshoot.
pros_cons: ["Quality of data collection","range of modules to choose from","wide recognition and industry visibility of the brand"]

review_title: Play Legos - The Microsoft way
usecases_deployment_scope: The main USP of Azure Logic Apps is its connectors. MS has come a long way in providing various connectors to different services. The main implementation I have used is for services that provided Rest APIs to connect and also amongst Microsoft Saas and Paas offerings. Using MSI enables the management of authentication while using Paas/Saas offerings like Azure Functions, Log analytics, etc. The other scope where I have used it the most is for Playbooks (it's just a logic app with Sentinel Trigger) which offers huge relief for automation of SIEM (Sentinel.)
likelihood_to_recommend: 1. For simple tasks / moderately difficult tasks (where there are not too many condition checks) 2. We have less time for development, and the Agenda is simple. 3. Avoid Azure Logic Apps when you are unsure about hitting the limits (check latest limitations of Azure Logic Apps in MS docs)
pros_cons: ["Connecting to different services using OOB connectors","Support for HTTP connectors which enables user to leverage RestAPIs","Readability, i.e., it looks just like a Visio diagram. Even managers or HRs can have a look and get to know what's happening","It's a Programmer's Lego. It's fun connecting them at the same time getting the work done"]

review_title: Secured Remote Access Solution
usecases_deployment_scope: BeyondTrust Privileged Remote Access has replaced our VPN solution for vendors and external users/partners. It allows us to grant secure remote access to specific resources in our internal networks to those external partners. It supports many types of applications and has a good granularity in terms of the types of privileges you can allow.
likelihood_to_recommend: BeyondTrust Password Safe, Nessus, Lansweeper
pros_cons: ["RDP Jump","Shell Jump","Web Jump","Protocol Tunnel Jump","VNC Jump"]

review_title: You have got to check out and implement F5 BIG-IP DNS for your geo Redundant Solution
usecases_deployment_scope: Geo Redundancy is vital in today's world and F5 BIG-IP DNS has been a Key component for our Mission Critical Communications. Easy, Fast and most importantly, reliable
likelihood_to_recommend: Geo Redundancy for Critical Communications
pros_cons: ["DNS synchronization across nodes","DNS Resolution","Integration with External DNS Server Providers"]

review_title: Great Text Utility
usecases_deployment_scope: As far as I know, I am the sole user of BBEdit at my organization, although I believe there may be a few users of its free sibling, TextWrangler. I have been using BBEdit for a long time, at least 15 years, maybe longer. The license I use at work is actually my own. Although there are many competitors in its space, I am still a devoted user. BBEdit is fast-loading, is powerful at many forms of text editing, supports GREP (regular expressions), supports many languages with the ability to add support for new ones, has advanced file system and internet tools, and works well for web development. I continue to use it because it gets the job done and I haven't found a better solution.
likelihood_to_recommend: I'm primarily a graphic designer who does occasional web development. For me, BBEdit works very well. I use it both for developer projects (editing code, editing system files) and for general text processing (cleaning up, formatting, or extracting text). I like that it offers real-time previews of edits to web project files. It comes with some nice editor themes and supports adding more or customizing them. I expect that for some coders, it will be inadequate. It is not an IDE. On the other end of the spectrum, someone who expects an experience more like Microsoft Word will be very disappointed; or if they wanted something more along the lines of Windows Notepad, they may find it to be overkill. It is an ASCII text editor with many advanced commands and tools built-in.
pros_cons: ["BBEdit has great file tools: access the file system, including hidden files and folders; direct FTP/SFTP support; access to Git and Subversion; support for projects (related files, such as the files for a website); access contents of ZIP archives; change file encoding (UTF, etc.); and more.","BBEdit has numerous commands for formatting text and especially code. There are many ways to select, copy, convert, format, search, replace, compare, and tidy up text and code projects. Its text processing is available to the OS X Automator app."]

review_title: UltiPro - The System In Review
usecases_deployment_scope: UltiPro is being used across the whole organization for payroll, HRIS, time and attendance and reporting. Without the solution we would not be able to report on demographics, effectively pay our associates or track time.
likelihood_to_recommend:
As an overall HCM system, UltiPro is great for a company looking for a system to handle the basic time and attendance needs and configurable payroll functions.

Companies looking for highly configurable time and attendance solutions, that tie well with payroll will need a more robust timekeeping system.

review_title: Amazing Product - You won't be disappointed!
usecases_deployment_scope: We utilize Paycom's payroll and onboarding features. Paycom's payroll processing is seamless considering we do not utilize their time and attendance. We come from the Staffing Industry where our payroll and billing is unique and requires us to use our own time and attendance platform. We have no issues importing the hours for payroll, the ease of importing large amounts of payroll information using templates has streamlined the payroll process as well. The electronic onboarding has removed all paper documentation, and we enjoy that we have visibility to each employee's HR files right at our fingertips. Everything is clean, seamless, and streamlined. We also never have to worry about downloading the most recent tax forms to provide to our employees, Paycom takes care of this for us as well.
likelihood_to_recommend: Our designated Payroll Rep visits often to discuss any issues, tell us about any new products we may be interested in, and have Paycom Learning sessions to help us utilize all of Paycom's functionality.  The documents and checklists I find to be very confusing.

review_title: If You Want to Save Time, Money, & Gain More Followers, Hootsuite Is for You!
usecases_deployment_scope: I use Hootsuite on a daily basis when I need to post something on all of our social media accounts. It is much more convenient than going to each individual social media platform and copying and pasting the same exact content. I also utilize Hootsuite when I need to schedule posts for either the weekend, if I'm going to be out-of-office, or for a holiday. I have never had a hiccup when using this software! Great use of money, well worth it, and it saves time!
likelihood_to_recommend: Hootsuite is great if you are looking to optimize your time at work with the convenience of just a button - "Post". Super convenient and saves a great deal of my time. Although, if you are looking for detailed analytics, suggested hashtags, or [the] best times to post, you may be looking in the wrong place.

review_title: Happy to do a Zoho Social review!
usecases_deployment_scope: I use Zoho to manage my organization's social media channels and it's been a game-changer! It makes scheduling and posting across multiple channels a breeze. Before switching to Zoho I was spending hours scheduling social media, now it just take minutes. Zoho also has great analytical and other tools that make social media management extremely effective.
likelihood_to_recommend: For small non-profit organizations, Zoho is probably the best tool out there for managing multiple social media accounts! In small organizations there is usually not a dedicated person or team for social media, so having a tool that can allow you post on 4 channels with one click is a dream come true. I have tried several other platforms and none of them come close to Zoho - highly recommend!

review_title: Trust Zoho!
usecases_deployment_scope: Zoho Social is used generally in our organization. We have lots of social media accounts and managing them without a trustworthy tool like Zoho is too difficult. I've been using Zoho's different components and products and I completely trust this company and know our social account won't be hacked or banned ever! So I suggest that everyone should use this platform.
likelihood_to_recommend: I've searched a lot about social management and social marketing tools  [in the past] because I didn't know Zoho had a social platform. As far as I found, Zoho has such a great platform, I stopped using others.

review_title: The most engaging social media management tool
usecases_deployment_scope: We are a new startup started using Zoho Social right from the inception. We use ZohoSocial mainly for the Social Media integration, Social Media post automation and for post analytics. We are planning to use the premium version of Zoho Social once very soon. Costwise it is little higher side for the small company but the services they provide were worth the cost.
likelihood_to_recommend: Zoho Social is easy to use without any training and it also has the intuitive ui. UX side needs to be improved little.

review_title: isolved Review
usecases_deployment_scope: Payroll and just about to add Timekeeping
likelihood_to_recommend: Well suited - We were concerned if we would receive our checks on time because of weather. isolved walked us through how we could print our own checks in house.  We did actually receive the checks on time but isolved followed up with us even over the weekend to make sure everything worked out. Not so good - Salespeople don't always understand what is being asked and they just promise things that can't actually happen.

review_title: Strengths and weaknesses
usecases_deployment_scope: I'm working in a trade union. In order to expand our services to members, we are giving legal advice to our members through Facebook and other social media. We are using different Facebook pages for each industry (construction, cleaning, household activities, safeguarding, ...) and we use AgoraPulse to publish items to our Facebook page and manage reactions. In our very decentralized organisation, only the central department is using AgoraPulse.
likelihood_to_recommend: Good for first line responses to customers. Less useful if you want to be able to export information about your users (e.g. tags.)

review_title: Good Stuff
usecases_deployment_scope: We use NUVI to monitor the sentiment of conversations about some of our controversial clients. This allows us to stay on top of the conversation and ensures we address any negative mentions.
likelihood_to_recommend: NUVI has worked well for monitoring controversial decisions. It is not as helpful for organizations that have broad missions or common names. For example one of our clients has "Kindle" in the name which makes it difficult to differentiate from conversations about the Amazon tablet, even when adjusting the monitor keywords included/excluded.

review_title: Intern
usecases_deployment_scope: iCIMS assists in our hiring of employees. review_title: iCIMS is as expected

review_title: Cornerstone OnDemand Admin Reflections
usecases_deployment_scope: Cornerstone OnDemand is currently being used by Southwest Powerpool as a company tool throughout our organization. We currently use the learning product the most. It is the source of record for training for our employees and our members. This is very helpful for audits. We utilize the Instructor-Led Training (ILT) function and online courses. This was very helpful, all my questions were resolved right then, and if he didn't know I had a response before the next meeting.On the other hand, after that time frame passed I no longer had the direct line of communication. I had to either sign up for an available office hour or open a ticket. They resolved my issue, just not as fast.

review_title: Absolutely the Best
usecases_deployment_scope: We use TriNet through the whole business. We use TriNet for payroll only at this time.
likelihood_to_recommend: I would definitely recommend TriNet to anyone looking for a good HR company. They are very helpful in all aspects.
