likelihood_to_recommend: [DropBox is well suited for] sharing Draft documents, final documents [and] attachments. Collaboration on projects is easy while working remote.
pros_cons: ["Quick Start up, simply create account and can start using","Allows multiple folders and subfolders to organize documents","Can be shared with anyone, they just have to make a free Dropbox account."]

review_title: Not up to expectations so far, but that may change thanks to the AE's
usecases_deployment_scope: We were looking to supplement our funnel with some additional leads within our target market. We were looking to get 300 leads over a two-month time period. These would be top-of-funnel leads, and not something we would expect to convert right away, but we understood that they would need to be nurtured. The process was originally understood to be that DemandScience would promote our content, people who were interested in our content would then, fill out a form, and we would have our lead.
likelihood_to_recommend: Demand science is great for getting high volume, very top-of-funnel contacts.  They should not really be considered "leads" as none of the people we came in contact with have actually reported to have read or seen the content that demand science was promoting on our behalf.  This is a way to fill an address book.  It may work better in a market not quite as niche as ours (radiology healthcare admin and physicians)
pros_cons: ["Strategy Sessions","Responsive AE's","Automated Delivery of Leads to CRM","Easy Lead return and refund process"]

review_title: Dropbox saves me time
usecases_deployment_scope:
Storage of large files associated with our construction projects. It helps us to store the data necessary so that we have access to it in the office or in the field.
We are also able to store pictures and plans of the various projects that we do. I’m t is a game changer for that purpose
likelihood_to_recommend: It is very well suited for storing large files in the cloud that would be otherwise difficult to do without the use of this program. It allows me to not have to carry paper files around with me to all of my job sites. The mobile app could be improved to work more like the standard app.
pros_cons: ["Storing plans","Storing scopes of work","Storing pictures"]

review_title: If You Care About Security You Should Only Use Dropbox for Business
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Dropbox in our department for internal collaboration and for external sharing. It's a great way to handle version control when collaborating with multiple users and an easy way to share large decks and PDFs with clients. Before we started using Dropbox, we had several versions of Excel or Word docs being passed around with a naming convention that didn't fit our teams' needs. It was a huge waste of time and effort trying to reconcile final edits before a deadline.
likelihood_to_recommend: If you're working with a large team that's mostly remote or has team members that travel often, I would recommend Dropbox for their business. If you're still emailing large files with an ftp or a free sharing service, I can't guarantee that those sites are as secure as Dropbox. The peace of mind you get is worth the small fee to maintain all your work.
pros_cons: ["Cloud based - I can access any docs as long as I have wifi. Even if I'm at an airport on my iPhone.","Visibility - Sharing and version control is easy to manage.","Ease of Use - new team members can learn the tool on their own in under 5 minutes saving me from having to train them on an additional tool."]

review_title: Exactly What You Would Expect, Which is What You Want It To Be
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Dropbox to work on documents together. This is especially important for manuscript writing. We also use Dropbox with collaborators to distribute files too large to send via email. The only downside to Dropbox is that files accumulate very quickly. For instance, if you have the system synced to your desktop, copies of the files are stored locally. If then a person uploads 100Gb to your shared folder, 100Gb of your desktop drive is instantly used. This can be alleviated by turning off the sync feature.
likelihood_to_recommend: Dropbox is great for file sharing and for multiple people to edit the same document. The two downsides are the file sync to your desktop and the number of conflicting copies that get saved. The file sync is convenient as it saves a copy of everything to your desktop, however, when other users upload large files it fills your hard drive very quickly. The conflicting copies issue is the result of two people having the same file open at the same time and making different versions of the same file. Every time this happens a new conflicting copy is created. It becomes confusing.
pros_cons: ["Syncing","Sharing to other users","Saving conflicting copies"]

review_title: Convenient Platform
usecases_deployment_scope: I use Dropbox in my organization to organize important assets and documents such as photography, videos, emails and PDFs. I work as a designer in marketing so it is important that all of my files are kept safe in an organized place, such as Dropbox. It stores a lot and makes me comfortable in knowing that I am storing important assets within a safe space that will not be lost.
likelihood_to_recommend: Dropbox is well suited for myself and my team because we know that we are storing our important (and large) files within an area that can be easily accessed throughout everyone without a fear of them getting lost. Everything is very easy to upload, although it takes time depending on how large your file size is. It is overall very effective within my job since I access it for important documents and assets on a daily basis.
pros_cons: ["Organized","Easy to Navigate","Spacious"]

review_title: Dropbox Mic Drop, or Why Dropbox Makes My Job Easier
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Dropbox primarily to send files between us and clients, as well as a digital co-working space for projects. Often, I'm working with other designers on multiple projects that require multiple people working on them. Dropbox makes syncing and updating changes easy and allows us to work on the same files remotely, wherever we may be.
likelihood_to_recommend: Dropbox is fantastic for people who need to easily share large files with clients, friends, family, whoever. With the Dropbox app installed on my Mac, I'm able to share a file in just a couple of clicks. It's also simple on the receiving side; clients can easily access files sent to them, as well as comment and add notes. The only downside is the amount of storage you receive at free and lower tiers of their product.
pros_cons: ["Sharing large files.","Easy syncing/uploading.","Commenting and adding notes."]

review_title: Every professional and modern website should have Dynamic Yield
usecases_deployment_scope: Shoepassion uses Dynamic Yield within the marketing department to optimize and personalize the e-commerce website. All product recommendations within the website and in advertising mails are also implemented with Dynamic Yield. With Dynamic Yield, website changes and website testing can be implemented much faster than in the traditional way, since most changes do not require an IT department. In addition, Dynamic Yield helps us to publish special actions quickly and efficiently on the website and to enable a very fast communication path to the customer. Dynamic Yield can also be used by employees who only have rudimentary IT skills and is therefore very versatile within the marketing department.
likelihood_to_recommend: Companies that want to tailor their website to the needs of the individual user should definitely try Dynamic Yield.
pros_cons: ["Data-driven personalization.","Data-driven recommendation.","Implementation of website changes very efficient.","Automated test results within different user segments."]

review_title: DraftSight Review
usecases_deployment_scope: We use DraftSight to modify old machine plans and old plans but also for the general installation of machines or infrastructures, electric pneumatic, IT. We also use it from time to time to realize hydraulic networks or kinematic diagrams. It is used in the design office and infrastructure departments but also in industrial maintenance.
likelihood_to_recommend: It is a good tool to realize the kinematic diagram to the Tauleac diagram. It is also interesting to work with to make machine installation plans, assembly plans. It was also easy to use for drawing topo, drawing machine, drawing pieces, drawing others and all modifications in AutoCAD, all versions.
pros_cons: ["Ease of use.","No need for a powerful computer.","Accessible to all."]

review_title: Draftsight - Great product, fantastic value
usecases_deployment_scope: We use the software for creating as-built drawings for site installation works, where points are taken by a GPS net rover and loaded onto Draftsight. We also use it for creating DXF files to be used in CNC plasma cutting once turned into g-code.
likelihood_to_recommend: [...] It works very well for [2d drawings for construction]. It does have a 3d selection that I have found to be a bit clumsy and I prefer to use fusion360 for instead.
pros_cons: ["Can manage larger drawings without suffering any/minimal lag","Very intuitive to use, similar to other mainstream programs that are significantly more expensive."]

review_title: Draftsight: Good job !
usecases_deployment_scope: DraftSight is being used for our engineering and production drawings, for some little electrical drawings too. I'm the only one to use it, but our engineering department is growing [...], our production department too, and we will probably need more licenses eventually. DraftSight fills a lack of drawings that existed before I joined the team.
likelihood_to_recommend: It is well suited for every need in mechanical drawings and machine layouts, such as new machine design or machine rebuilding process. [It] can be useful in the process of reverse engineering old equipment. It is less appropriate for electrical drawings. 2D drawings from online databases lack in content (way more adapted for 3D than 2D).
pros_cons: ["Engineering drawings","Production drawings","Electrical drawings"]

review_title: Drafting with DraftSight
usecases_deployment_scope: I've used DraftSight at previous employers to review .dwg drawings and create my own for plant layouts, machine design, and other manufacturing needs. It was a user-friendly tool that met all of my needs. So when I got to my current organization I recognized similar needs for software capable of performing these functions. I presented my case to the General Manager and he approved my purchase. I've since begun sharing its capabilities to other sites.
likelihood_to_recommend: DraftSight is a great program for developing plant layouts, cart designs, Machine designing and other basic drafting concepts. It is an economical option for bringing into an organization or department and allow dwg files to be opened and shared. I've been using it for over 10 years and at some organizations I've had access to it as well as one of its main competitors software and more often I found myself utilizing DraftSight as my "go-to" software.
pros_cons: ["Super friendly user interface and tutorials on how to get started","Develop 2D plant layouts or machine drawings","Economical option to bring into an Organization / Company Location the ability to develop .dwg files"]

review_title: 100% Do Not recommend
usecases_deployment_scope: Emarsys is being used for email marketing in the marketing department.
likelihood_to_recommend: A scenario where Emarsys would do well is at a company where they make simple emails for smaller audiences. Anything outside of routine and simple email marketing including email automation would not be advisable.
pros_cons: ["Haven't found anything it does particularly well"]

review_title: Zoom to the Top with Zoom Quality Management Suite
usecases_deployment_scope: I provided support services and testing for a large electric utility that was looking at the software. The business problem that the company was specifically interested in was its ability to record the interactions and to record customer satisfaction. This was very important to my client. They had some internal setup to do a little of it but there was no regular system for it and that left the company open to possible litigation. They had very little quality control over their agent's behavior and the only way they might get feedback was if a customer contacted them directly later.
likelihood_to_recommend: One scenario where it is best suited is when a company is setting up a new team of agents.  The process is very easy to follow.  The software is intuitive in operation, easy to explain, and lends itself to ease of use in a short amount of time for the agents.  It is not suitable for a location that deals with a variety of languages - if the people reviewing the interactions do not speak or understand the recorded sessions.
pros_cons: ["Recording Agent interactions. It is simple and easy to adopt and retrieving them is also convenient.","The follow up with the customer experience is smooth and flawless.","The ease of initial installation and the operations of it including adding and removing agents."]

review_title: The best tool to understand your communities and measure the performance of your social media strategy
usecases_deployment_scope: SocialBakers Analytics is our main platform to analyse and centralize the insights of our various social media platforms. It also allows us to benchmark all our principal competitors and compare with the average of our market. It's a real-time decision making tool that helps us maintain the highest level of engagement with our communities and response rate from the team. It's used by the whole social media department in order to share social media insights with the rest of the company, board included.
likelihood_to_recommend: Which social media platforms need to be monitored? (Should be in the list that SocialBakers includes)How many competitors do you need to monitor? (Cost is per profile monitored)
pros_cons: ["Engagement Rate is clearly defined in SocialBakers and can be compared with competitors. Its definitely a metric and not only a concept in this platform.","Response Rate Insight give us a clear insight of the performance of our team in order to maintain the quality of service we provide to fans/communities/customers.","Presentation of data in SocialBakers Analytics platform is complete and simple at the same time, the tool can be used by social media expert and newbies at the same time."]

review_title: Vital for start ups in hyper growth mode
usecases_deployment_scope: SpaceIQ is super simple to use and vital for a company that is experiencing growing pains. We have to rearrange desks nearly once a month so to find anyone in our company, you need an up to date map like SpaceIQ. It's been very user-friendly integrates with Okta which is great.
likelihood_to_recommend: If you work for a startup in hyper-growth mode, SpaceIQ is VITAL. We rearrange desks nearly once a month and we heavily rely on SpaceIQ to keep organized. We have a lot of cross-functional teams, so before making the trek to meet a colleague, I'm always using SpaceIQ to map my journey.
pros_cons: ["Integrates with Okta","Easy to search for people/rooms","Color coding helps to navigate fast"]

review_title: Credit Manager's Review
usecases_deployment_scope: All 5 of our franchises use TermSync for Accounts Receivable Collections. It has virtually eliminated our 90 past due column. The automated past due reminders drive our customers to the portal where they can view their account, print an invoice or make a payment.
likelihood_to_recommend: AutoPay is ideal for us
pros_cons: ["Sends out automated reminders","Makes copies of invoices self service","Makes online payments easy"]

review_title: ESET Endpoint Security - Guaranteed protection and user experience
author_position: Diretor de Tecnologia da Informação e Telecomunicação
usecases_deployment_scope: ESET Endpoint Security is used throughout the organization, on Windows servers and on desktops. Its main function is to centrally address threats and malware. In a single interface, I can manage the entire equipment park and define several business rules for each institution environment, such as access, release, installation and update application policies.
likelihood_to_recommend:
In general, ESET Endpoint Security is suitable for any scenario, both large companies and micro companies, and even for home use. Its price is attractive and its use is relatively easy, not needing several operators to manage it.
The only however is, as stated before, its use is primarily made for windows environment. This creates an obstacle for heterogeneous environments.
pros_cons: ["Security situation of servers and desktops","Easy targeting of security policies","Scheduling tasks and actions, such as server analysis, remote scanning, software installation, diagnostics and many others","Audit, automation, hardware inventory status reports"]

review_title: Great product for the value, but has room for growth.
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Evolution as a B2B platform for our customer to make purchases, get pricing, and manage their account.
likelihood_to_recommend: Overall, I think Evolution is a great option for small to mid-size businesses. We did not have a hard time getting set up and have not had any major issues since launching our site with them. That said, there are opportunities for them to expand upon some of their basic features. Mobile functionality also leaves a lot to be desired.
pros_cons: ["The platform is fairly easy to understand.","Integrations with our ERP have remained smooth over time.","Enough customization to differentiate your site and not make it feel like a \"cookie cutter\" site."]

review_title: Events are a breeze with Eventbrite.
usecases_deployment_scope: We use Eventbrite to sell tickets to our events and to handle registration and check-in at our events. We used to do a list in Excel, and Eventbrite has allowed us to go digital, accept credit cards, and even do some marketing to those who have attended events in the past.
likelihood_to_recommend: I would say that Eventbrite is well suited for companies or organizations that do a few events throughout the year and do not need to pay for fancy software to handle ticket sales and check-in. I think it is also designed for a small marketing team where you might have one person handling all of the promotions and sales.
pros_cons: ["It's easy to use.","You can copy previous events.","It has a nice payment processor."]

review_title: ExpressionEngine has potential
usecases_deployment_scope: ExpressionEngine was one of the alternatives that we used separate from WordPress. It was a product that we used at Big Sea when WordPress wasn't sufficient for the client's needs.ExpressionEngine was our go to for clients that needed a heavily robust site without default bells and whistles. These projects included a large number of different streams of data (blog, staff members, locations, news, departments) all with interconnectivity in a way that was quick to set up.The primary downside to ExpressionEngine is that it is a bare minimum out of the box, and that it essentially requires third party extensions in order for it to be efficient. However, this is a plus when you want to clean up the bells and whistles in the admin to only the essentials that the client will eventually need.I love the power of ExpressionEngine, but it's usually way more (less?) than we need for our projects, as it takes longer to set up the initial configuration. The handling of the theme is actually far more to my liking over WordPress, as literally every file you create is created for YOU, and not because the theme requires it.
likelihood_to_recommend: If you're looking for a quick product set up, and getting it out the door, this is not an appropriate system for you. However, if you have a large project with a lot of moving parts that can be resolved with the plugins and what they offer, this is an awesome solution.
pros_cons: ["Extremely robust. To be able to start from absolute scratch in the CMS and get it configured precisely to each individual client's needs.","Combined with Pixel and Tonic's Matrix and Playa addons alone, EE's channel fields become a whole new world of awesome."]
